item.title: Homo Ludens by Johan Huizinga
item.description: Who are we as a species? Are the reasonable ones? Can we be defined by our unique use of reason? Does our reason justify future optimism about the state of the planet, or universe and our relationships to these? Should we define ourselves by our abilities to manipulate and cause lasting and irreversible change to our environments? Or should we instead define ourselves by a trait that we have in common with all mammals?
